title: Cannot select Generic tests from command line

milestone.description: This is a bug-fix-only release, following the initial release of 3.0.

body:
When running `NUnit Console Runner 3.0.5797` with a test selection that includes a generic type argument, I get and error an no tests are run:

```
>nunit3-console.exe  WebTests.dll --where "test == WebTests._3DSecure.Test_3DSecure<BrowserStackDriverBuilder>.Test_MC_CardholderEnrolled_AuthenticationNotAbleToComplete"
NUnit Console Runner 3.0.5797
Copyright (C) 2015 Charlie Poole

Runtime Environment
   OS Version: Microsoft Windows NT 6.3.9600.0
  CLR Version: 4.0.30319.42000

Test Files
    WebTests.dll

Test Filters
    Where: test == WebTests._3DSecure.Test_3DSecure<BrowserStackDriverBuilder>.Test_MC_CardholderEnrolled_AuthenticationNotAbleToComplete

System.Xml.XmlException: The 'BrowserStackDriverBuilder' start tag on line 1 position 48 does not match the end tag of 'test'. Line 1, position 135.
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw(Exception e)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ThrowTagMismatch(NodeData startTag)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseEndElement()
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseElementContent()
   at System.Xml.XmlLoader.LoadNode(Boolean skipOverWhitespace)
   at System.Xml.XmlLoader.LoadDocSequence(XmlDocument parentDoc)
   at System.Xml.XmlDocument.Load(XmlReader reader)
   at System.Xml.XmlDocument.LoadXml(String xml)
   at NUnit.Engine.Internal.XmlHelper.CreateXmlNode(String xml)
   at NUnit.Engine.Runners.MasterTestRunner.InsertFilterElement(XmlNode resultNode, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Engine.Runners.MasterTestRunner.RunTests(ITestEventListener listener, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Engine.Runners.MasterTestRunner.NUnit.Engine.ITestRunner.Run(ITestEventListener listener, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.ConsoleRunner.ConsoleRunner.RunTests(TestPackage package, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.ConsoleRunner.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

If I try xml/html escaping the test name, I get:

```
NUnit.Engine.TestSelectionParserException: Unexpected token '&' at position 0 in selection expression.
   at NUnit.Engine.TestSelectionParser.Expect(Token[] valid)
   at NUnit.Engine.TestSelectionParser.ParseFilterElement()
   at NUnit.Engine.TestSelectionParser.ParseFilterTerm()
   at NUnit.Engine.TestSelectionParser.ParseFilterExpression()
   at NUnit.Engine.TestFilterBuilder.GetFilter()
   at NUnit.ConsoleRunner.ConsoleRunner.Execute()
   at NUnit.ConsoleRunner.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

Specifying the name name of the test using the deprecated `--test` argument results in an error too:

```
C:\>nunit3-console.exe WebTests.dll --test "WebTests._3DSecure.Test_3DSecure<BrowserStackDriverBuilder>.Test_MC_CardholderEnrolled_AuthenticationNotAbleToComplete"
NUnit Console Runner 3.0.5797
Copyright (C) 2015 Charlie Poole

Runtime Environment
   OS Version: Microsoft Windows NT 6.3.9600.0
  CLR Version: 4.0.30319.42000

Test Files
    WebTests.dll

Test Filters
    Test: WebTests._3DSecure.Test_3DSecure<BrowserStackDriverBuilder>.Test_MC_CardholderEnrolled_AuthenticationNotAbleTo
Complete

System.Xml.XmlException: The 'BrowserStackDriverBuilder' start tag on line 1 position 48 does not match the end tag of '
test'. Line 1, position 135.
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.Throw(Exception e)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ThrowTagMismatch(NodeData startTag)
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseEndElement()
   at System.Xml.XmlTextReaderImpl.ParseElementContent()
   at System.Xml.XmlLoader.LoadNode(Boolean skipOverWhitespace)
   at System.Xml.XmlLoader.LoadDocSequence(XmlDocument parentDoc)
   at System.Xml.XmlDocument.Load(XmlReader reader)
   at System.Xml.XmlDocument.LoadXml(String xml)
   at NUnit.Engine.Internal.XmlHelper.CreateXmlNode(String xml)
   at NUnit.Engine.Runners.MasterTestRunner.InsertFilterElement(XmlNode resultNode, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Engine.Runners.MasterTestRunner.RunTests(ITestEventListener listener, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.Engine.Runners.MasterTestRunner.NUnit.Engine.ITestRunner.Run(ITestEventListener listener, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.ConsoleRunner.ConsoleRunner.RunTests(TestPackage package, TestFilter filter)
   at NUnit.ConsoleRunner.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

I can't find any test cases related to parsing generic type arguments, so I don't know if this is expected behaviour.
